intro: Eriocoma cuspidata, commonly known as the hooked eriocoma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that are clustered in a spherical shape, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine, silky hairs, contributing to its unique texture. Eriocoma cuspidata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions.
